> Are there plans to support HyperNEAT in the Python version?

Unfortunately, not yet. But it's on my to-do list.

> Also, I'd be interested to extend NEAT Python with Parallel Python
> (http://www.parallelpython.com/) to allow evaluations on multiple
> cores and machines.

You can use Parallel Python with NEAT-Python, just take a look at the
xor2_parallel.py example. It allows you to run the xor experiment in
parallel (or distributed).

> I've never worked with GPUs, but nVidia's CUDA capabilities look
> promising. PyStream (http://code.google.com/p/pystream/) isn't being
> supported anymore by Tech-X. Their new GPUlib
> (http://www.txcorp.com/technologies/GPULib/index.php) supports
> multiple languages. Again, this would be for evaluating fitness
> functions. Any experience or thoughts here?

I see lots of potential using GPUs, but it depends strictly on the
type of problem you're tyring to solve.

Cesar
